page.title: 07Field Names/Guyzance Area.
page.content: The farmland in this area was enclosed in the 18th.& 19th.centuries from when the present field pattern dates.Fields are given names to enable farmers to direct their workers etc.Field names change from time to time but many have survived from pre-enclosure times eg. Butt=shortened strips eg.Arthur's Butt Rigg=arable strips eg.Rough Riggs; Haugh=flat land near river eg.Long Chapel Haugh,The Heughs; Flatts=level ground eg.Mill Flatts; Leazes=pasture land eg.Near & Far Leazes; Lee=clearings eg.High Broad Lee. Some fields have been named after owners eg.Ned's Banks,Ann's Close and Widow's Close. The main East Coast Railway resulted in changes in field boundaries and new names were given eg.East and West Railway Fields.
